8,1



The ultimate swashbuckler film starring the dashing Errol Flynn in his most famous role is presented for the first time ever on DVD!

This painstakingly restored edition of 'The Adventures Of Robin Hood' will be presented in Warner Bros.' dazzling new "Ultra-Resolution" format which allows today's viewers to see parts of the images which were never visible before and sharper detail than in conventional Technicolor release prints.

Director Michael Curtiz

Certificate 12 years and over

Year 1938

Screen Fullscreen 4:3

Languages English - Dolby Digital (1.0) Mono


Additional Languages Spanish German 

Subtitles Danish English Finnish French Greek Hebrew Icelandic Italian Norwegian 

Polish Portuguese Slovenian Spanish Swedish Turkish Czech German Hungarian

Duration 1 hour and 38 minutes (approx)

Region Region 2
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b]Special Features[/b]
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Disc One: 
Audio commentary from author and film historian Rudy Behlmer 
Isolated music track showcasing the Oscar-winning score 
'Warner Bros.' Night at the Movies 1938', introduced by Leonard Maltin, comprising: 'Angels With Dirty Faces' theatrical trailer, vintage Warner Bros. cartoon 'Katnip Kollege', vintage Warner Bros. musical short subject 'Freddie Rich And His Orchestra' and a vintage newsreel 
Disc Two: 
'Glorious Technicolour': Angela Lansbury narrates this celebration of this legendary color filmmaking process (60 mins) 
'Welcome To Sherwood: The Story of The Adventures of Robin Hood': an all-new 65th anniversary documentary 
'Robin Hood Through The Ages
: a look at Robin Hood's earlier screen adaptations 
'A Journey To Sherwood Forest': home movies and behind-the-scenes footage 
'Splitting The Arrow' galleries comprising: Historical Art, Costume Designs, Scene Concept Drawings, Cast & Crew Photos and Publicity & Poster Materials 
Vintage Warner short subjects: 'Cavalcade Of Archery' (1945) and 'The Cruise Of The Zaca' (1952) with Errol Flynn 
Two Looney Tunes classic cartoons featuring Bugs Bunny (Rabbit Hood) and daffy Duck (Robin Hood Daffy) 
'From The Cutting Room': outtakes and 'Breakdowns Of 1938' Warner Bros. studio blooper reel
